label: 部
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Groups of farmers, potters, fishermen, hunters, etc. who were bound together in political units under the control of specific clans (uji). Constituted a caste of workers, serving their masters, the clansmen (uji-bito), being the economic foundation of the clan (uji) society. Contributed annually specified amounts of products or labor to the clan. Members were aborigines, prisoners of war, criminals. Be members were below the clansmen in the social scale, but above the slaves (nuhi). [氏、氏人、奴婢]
